title:
A Cost-Effective Eye-Tracker for Early Detection of Mild Cognitive
  Impairment
authors:
Danilo Greco, Francesco Masulli, Stefano Rovetta, Alberto Cabri,
  Davide Daffonchio
abstract:
This paper presents a low-cost eye-tracker aimed at carrying out tests based
on a Visual Paired Comparison protocol for the early detection of Mild
Cognitive Impairment. The proposed eye-tracking system is based on machine
learning algorithms, a standard webcam, and two personal computers that
constitute, respectively, the "Measurement Sub-System" performing the test on
the patients and the "Test Management Sub-System" used by medical staff for
configuring the test protocol, recording the patient data, monitoring the test
and storing the test results. The system also integrates an stress estimator
based on the measurement of heart rate variability obtained with
photoplethysmography.
